Whatever sensations are experienced in T: Whatever sight you see with your eye is unlikable, not likable; undesirable, not desirable; unpleasant, not pleasant.
Whatever sound you hear is unlikable, not likable; undesirable, not desirable; unpleasant, not pleasant.
Whatever odor you smell is unlikable, not likable; undesirable, not desirable; unpleasant, not pleasant.
Whatever flavor you taste is unlikable, not likable; undesirable, not desirable; unpleasant, not pleasant.
Whatever touch you feel is unlikable, not likable; undesirable, not desirable; unpleasant, not pleasant.
Whatever thought you know with your mind is unlikable, not likable; undesirable, not desirable; unpleasant, not pleasant.
Ascetics and brahmins who don’t truly un: They take pleasure in choices that lead to rebirth
They continue to make such choices
Having made such choices, they burn with the fever of rebirth, old age, and death, of sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress.
They’re not freed from rebirth, old age, and death, from sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress.
They’re not freed from suffering, I say.
Ascetics and brahmins who truly understa: They don’t take pleasure in choices that lead to rebirth
Having stopped making such choices, they don’t burn with the fever of rebirth, old age, and death, of sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress.
They’re freed from rebirth, old age, and death, from sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress.
They’re freed from suffering, I say.
